853599616:
[

Managers - Assurance - Australia and New Zealand

Company Name EY Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 49 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

From small businesses to some of the world’s best-known brands, our clients count on reliable financial statements, information and processes to inform their on-going strategies. More than ever, business is about interpreting and reacting to complex data — and they look to us for advice and services they can trust every time. You will use your professional skills and experience to make it happen, handling complex audit procedures across your designated market.

The opportunity

We are seeking a driven and ambitious Manager to play a key role in driving growth by developing new and existing client relationships, leading highly skilled project teams and delivering a first class customer experience on high-profile engagements. In return for helping us build a better working world you can expect excellent career opportunities within a dynamic and collaborative environment.

Your Key Responsibilities

Everything you will do will come back to providing exceptional analytical insights for our clients. Colleagues and clients from a diverse array of backgrounds will look to you first for answers so you will be a high-profile contact when it comes to resolving complex issues. You will be a credible and motivated, leading high calibre teams and winning new business in the market.

Skills And Attributes For Success
  • Leading audit engagements, defining audit strategies, managing team performance and keeping engagement leaders updated
  • Effectively managing Audit processes with appropriate consideration of audit risk issues and accounting technical matters
  • Coach and mentor other less experienced staff through sharing experience and knowledge
  • Engaging clients and providing authoritative advice and professionalism throughout transactions, including identifications of improvements in business processes and possible recommendations and prepare and deliver these to clients.
  • Constantly developing your understanding of current market trends and processes and sharing your knowledge to develop junior colleagues
  • Understanding our clients’ unique ambitions and needs and referring them to colleagues in other teams and areas to broaden our business relationships where possible
  • Expertise in accounting frameworks (IFRS) and in related financial reporting matters
To qualify for the role you must have
  • 6+ years’ experience as an auditor
  • Experience leading the planning, execution and reporting on audits
  • Proven track record with developing and maintaining client relationships
  • Excellent communication and negotiation skills and a collaborative approach to management
  • Expertise in accounting frameworks (IFRS) and in related financial reporting matters
  • A strong academic record, including a degree and completion of a recognised accounting qualification (CA, CPA, ACCA)
Ideally, you will also have
  • Knowledge of current market issues in Australia

What We Look For

We are interested in leaders with a genuine creative vision and the confidence to make it happen. You can expect plenty of autonomy in this role, so you will also need the ability to take initiative and seek out opportunities to improve our current relationships and processes. If you are serious about auditing and ready to take on some of our clients’ most complex issues, this role is for you.

What Working At EY Offers

We offer a competitive remuneration package where you will be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions. Plus, we offer
  • Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues around
  • Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
  • The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that is right for you
EY is committed to being an inclusive employer and we are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. We strive to achieve the right balance for our people, enabling us to deliver excellent client service whilst allowing you to build your career without sacrificing your personal priorities. While our client-facing professionals can be required to travel regularly, and at times be based at client sites, our flexible working arrangements can help you to achieve a lifestyle balance.

About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we will make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Join us in building a better working world.

Apply now.

The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by Ernst & Young or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary is AUD92,000 (depending on location) including 9.5% superannuation for applicants hired into Australia.

2018 Ernst & Young, Australia. All Rights Reserved

  • Provide detailed design and analysis of all hydraulic components relating to building projects across various sectors.
  • Liaise directly with clients, other consultants, architect and builders; throughout both design and construction phases.
  • Attend key site inspections and meetings.
  • Assist in the development and coordination of documentation and ensuring that client requirements are met within the specified budget and timeframe. \xa0

\xa0

You should be able to demonstrate:

  • Degree qualifications in engineering (Mechanical or Civil).
  • Minimum 3 - 5 years’ industry experience in building services hydraulic engineering.
  • Have experience and good knowledge for the design of sewer, sanitary plumbing, stormwater, water services etc.
  • Proven experience in a commercial building services consulting engineering environment
  • Capable of preparing reports, specifications and other written correspondence.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with both engineers and draftspersons across all disciplines.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  • A drive to further develop your career within a very technically competent team.

\xa0

What we offer:

  • The opportunity to join an exceptionally supportive and close-knit team of over ten strong.
  • Career growth with excellent training and development opportunities
  • A range of employee benefits, including paid overtime, additional leave, active social club and yearly bonuses
  • Flexible working arrangements


\xa0

Please send your CV and a covering letter to hr@irwinconsult.com.au

843022242:
[

Estimator

Company Name Blue Star Group Australia Company Location Sunshine, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 53 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Location – Sunshine, Melbourne

  • Display and VM POS industry leader
  • Modern facilities and working environment
  • Blue chip clients


Blue Star DISPLAY is a subsidiary of ASX listed IVE Group - Australia’s most diversified print and marketing communications business.


With operations in Sydney and Melbourne, Blue Star DISPLAY specialises in the design/creation and the production of VM POS, temporary, semi-permanent and permanent retail displays.

Our state-of-the-art facilities house the latest technology, providing large scale capability across Offset and Wide Format printing, finishing, kitting and warehousing. \xa0

Our services also include off-shore sourcing where appropriate through a dedicated team based in Asia.


About The Role


Blue Star DISPLAY VIC is currently looking for an experienced, commercially sound and success oriented Estimator to join our team. You will be required to draw upon your knowledge base and experience to estimate a diverse range of projects expediently and accurately, with the primary focus on wide format digital, finishing, packing and kitting for our retail based clients with POS and Display requirements.

\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0

Estimators play a vital role within the business through the production of accurate and detailed quotations for our clients. These go on to form the basis of all work instructions for jobs entering our production environment. We currently have a great opportunity for a person to join the Estimating team. Working closely within a small team within the Sales environment, the successful candidate will have the ability to communicate and establish functional relationships comfortably at all levels of the organization.


To be successful in this role, experience and a strong understanding of Print production is essential. Strong computer literacy and numerical skills are essential to be able to estimate and evaluate requests for quotations from our Sales team.


Our clients require us to work on innovative solutions and one off projects, thus the work can be both challenging and varied. You will be required to meet tight deadlines for all quotations and will be expected to demonstrate a consultative and collaborative approach. Excellent communication skills and attention to detail are a must and a positive, helpful attitude is essential.


In return for this we offer you the opportunity to be part of a large and successful business and a chance to be a key team member. Specific responsibilities include:


  • Working within the existing estimating, production and sales team to estimate POS projects
  • Clearly interpret clients briefs and specifications to reflect client requirements
  • Manage and control multiple estimates to multiple stake-holders
  • Maintain proactive and positive internal client relationships with sales, production and shopfloor staff
  • Ensure documentation and deliverables are of a high standard
  • Contribute to the successful outcomes of the account service team by promoting teamwork and displaying a friendly and positive attitude


About you:


A team player, you will have the following skills and experience:


  • Previous experience as an Estimator in Printing or a similar or related industry
  • Clear understanding of the processes in a printing and manufacturing environment
  • A sound knowledge of substrates, stocks, their end use and supply chain
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work flexibly as a member of a team
  • A proactive approach to communication and to issue identification and resolution
  • Great problem solving skills
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Excellent organisational and time management skills


If you believe you are the right person for this job, please apply now! We want to hear from you.

Please attach a resume with your application.

[

Retention Insights Analyst

Company Name TAL Australia Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 135 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Providing actionable insights
  • Identifying opportunities for continuous improvement
  • Melbourne based role
Welcome to This Australian Life.

From the millions of Australians we protect, to those that make it happen every day at TAL, people really are what we’re all about.

TAL needs people who represent our diverse Australian community. People who embrace our spirit and inspire confidence in their colleagues, customers and community. People who are passionate about making the most of the choices and options we provide. People who do what’s right, aim high, and work smart.

About The Opportunity

The Retention Insights team as part of the Portfolio Management team oversees the Retention Strategy for the TAL Individual Life businesses.

In the position of Retention Insights Analyst you will be responsible for providing actionable insights into reason for customer lapse together with identifying opportunities for continuous improvement across TAL’s Retention activities.

You will also be required for providing monthly reporting for the Retention Steering Committee and looking for opportunities to automate and simplify the compilation of data and reporting.

In This Role You Will Be Responsible For
  • Extracting and analysing large volumes of data to derive key insights into reasons for customer lapse
  • Working with the Customer Retention team and data to identify opportunities for continuous improvement across TAL’s Retention activities
  • Coordinating and preparing materials for regular monthly retention steering committee meetings and forums with stakeholders to discuss retention activity
  • Automating and simplifying data and reporting
  • Supporting team with Ad-hoc analysis and requests

About You

To be successful in this role you will have:
  • Proven analytical capability
  • Proven competency using SQL and Excel
  • Experience using visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau
  • Proven competency with bringing together multiple sources of data and manipulating it to visualise and report on with minimal help from others
  • Ability to present to senior stakeholders and turning observations into insights and actions
  • Ability to work independently and proactively
Work is a big part of this Australian life, and we work hard to make it one of the best parts. We want our employees to work in ways that suits their life and the nature of their role, so they feel able to meet their work life commitments and support their wellbeing. Everyone’s welcome to work for us – regardless of their age, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status or any disabilities they might be living with.

We know it’s the people we work with and experiences we share that make work meaningful and fulfilling, and we’d love for you to be part of it.

You don’t have to be an artist, adventurer, doer or dreamer, but it really helps.

If you would like to apply or refer a friend please click on the relevant button below and follow the instructions. Alternatively, if you would like further information please contact Rebecca Cunningham, Talent Acquisition Partner on Rebecca.Cunningham@tal.com.au

National Business Manager

Company Name Miller Leith Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 293 views

Job description

The Company

This Australian owned and operated company is seen as an industry leader within the FMCG industry. They offer an innovative range to the consumer and have continued to experience a significant transformation within the business. Due to recent changes within the organisation, they require an experienced Business Development Manager to join the Sales team.


The Role

Reporting to the Head of Sales, the Business Manager – Aldi will be responsible for effectively leading the Aldi channel to ensure revenue and profit targets are achieved. Working cross functionally, this position is responsible for range reviews, forging partnerships, sourcing, forecasting and promotional activity.

With a strong understanding of the Aldi channel the Business Manager, will develop strategic partnerships to achieve long term objectives for the business.


Skills & Experience

Exceptional project management skills are essential to ensure the effective overall management of the account and the strength of relationships built with buyers will be second to none. \xa0

To be successful in this role you will ideally have:

A tertiary qualifications in Marketing, Commerce, Business or relevant


  • Demonstrated experience in commodity trading
  • Strong commercial acumen coupled with the ability to lead at an executive level
  • Strong understanding of financial modelling analysing and forecast for the seasonal business model.
  • Experience in Managing the Aldi account, negotiating and forging long term strategic partnerships


Humble and hungry, as the Business Manager you will have excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to influence at all levels. You will have innate ability to build relationships and effectively negotiate and influence with peers and customers will be crucial in this autonomous role. You would be known as ‘a fixer’, be highly driven and not afraid and adaptable to change.


Benefits

  • South eastern location,
  • A good culture offering Flexibility and autonomy
  • Career development opportunities
  • An opportunity to grow with the business

Health And Safety Manager

Company Name Fonterra Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 293 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Be the influencer & advocate for all HSW initiatives in site Leadership meetings
  • Lead the development of a culture that promotes a proactive approach to HS&W
  • State of the art office, fantastic culture with onsite parking in beautiful Richmond


The Opportunity:
Reporting through to the GM Health, Safety & Wellbeing; we have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Health & Safety Manager to join our corporate team in our new modern offices located in Richmond


As a key member of the onsite corporate team and working in conjunction with site HSW Leads; you will business partner and provide ongoing safety leadership, coaching and support to all Transport & Logistics, Farm Source & Corporate team’s onsite including our offsite locations across Victoria & Tasmania. Key to success will be your ability to monitor & lead HSW performance and continuously improve and drive safety, compliance & wellbeing initiatives, culture, systems and processes to ensure a reduction in incidents and associated costs.


As a member of HSW team; you will also be responsible for:


  • Developing improvement plans and aligning these to the wider Australian HSW strategy and local business activities.
  • Leading investigations (RCA and ICAM) and supporting the implementation of corrective actions following workplace incidents.
  • Advising and supporting the teams to achieve compliance to HSW Management System.
  • Contribute to the development of the HSW management system, heavy vehicle and chain of responsibility standards and drive its implementation across their area of responsibility through training, coaching and influencing of teams.
  • Ensuring business achieves demonstrated continuous improvement onsite through overall risk mitigation.
  • Business partner with teams to support capex submissions and implementation of compliance solutions for ongoing risk mitigation.
  • Undertake regular inspections and audits of fleet teams to ensure compliance to heavy vehicle standards and chain of responsibility (COR).


What You’ll Bring & Develop:
You will bring solid practical generalist experience in a Health & Safety Management role, preferably within the transport and logistics industry, and have a relevant Tertiary qualification in OHS or equivalent. Critical to your success will be your ability to influence, lead and inspire Health, Safety and Wellbeing practices and continuous improvement initiatives at a Corporate/Site Leader level as will be your ability to motivate and enhance workplace culture.\xa0


You will also be:

  • Trained in Root Cause Analysis, Proficient in risk mitigation and ideally exposed to ICAM
  • Experienced in Implementing HSW management systems and Heavy Vehicle Standards/COR
  • Strong HS&W performance analysis and reporting skills


As you develop your stakeholder management & influencing skills; this role will provide plenty of scope and exposure across the broader business. A real opportunity to excel your career with a reputable company who values and supports their staff. We will assist your career goals & turn them into reality, so why wait? And submit your application today!


For more information on this role, please contact Craig McDonald our Senior Talent Partner on (03) 8541 1120 for a confidential discussion or simply apply now!
